conclusion: Four identical wooden blocks (A, B, C, D) are placed on a smooth horizontal surface. Blocks B and C are connected by a light spring within its elastic limit. A horizontal pulling force F is applied to block B, causing all blocks to accelerate together with the same acceleration.
Block B is being pulled to the right by a force F. Blocks B and C are connected by a spring. Blocks A and D are positioned on either side of the spring.

premise: The force F is applied to block B, and all blocks accelerate together with the same acceleration.
conclusion: The acceleration of block B is a.

premise: According to Newton's second law, the net force acting on block B is equal to its mass times its acceleration.
conclusion: The force F is equal to m_B × a.

premise: Block C is connected to block B by a spring within its elastic limit. When block B accelerates, the spring stretches, causing block C to accelerate.
conclusion: The acceleration of block C is a.

premise: According to Newton's second law, the net force acting on block C is equal to its mass times its acceleration.
conclusion: The force acting on block C is equal to m_C × a.

premise: Block D is not connected to block B or C. The only force acting on block D is the frictional force opposing its motion.
conclusion: The acceleration of block D is a.

premise: According to Newton's second law, the net force acting on block D is equal to its mass times its acceleration.
conclusion: The frictional force acting on block D is equal to m_D × a.

premise: The static friction force is the minimum force that opposes the motion of block D.
conclusion: The static friction force f_s is equal to m_D × a.

premise: The blocks are accelerating together with the same acceleration, so the acceleration of block D is also a.
conclusion: The frictional force f is equal to the static friction force f_s.

premise: The total force F causes all four blocks to accelerate together with the same acceleration.
conclusion: The total mass of the system is 4m, and the acceleration a is F / (4m).

premise: The frictional force acting on block D is equal to m_D × a, and all blocks have the same mass m.
conclusion: The frictional force acting on block D is F / 4.
